lines.text:
[looking at a hair product]
Contains no lye. Well, I should hope not. Ask me no question I'll tell you no lye.
Oh, Mama you are being silly.
Well, why not? That thick glossy perm has gone to my head.

[talking about Val's attempted suicide]
Olivia, something terrible has happened.
What? Did you run out of eye make-up?
I know love is blind, but is it deaf and dumb too?
You are such a slut!
Well, it takes one to know one, doesn't it, dear?
Oh, by the way, Paige, are you still sleeping with Greg?
Morning, noon and night. He just keeps getting better and better.
I didn't think so. Well, have a nice day.
[Abby leaves]
Bitch.
You don't know the meaning of the word trust!
Sweetie, yes, I do.
The only kind of trust you know has the word "fund" behind it.
I thought I heard someone splashing out here.
I hope you don't mind.
No, suit yourself.
I couldn't find a bathing suit.
I can see that.
Well, why don't you join me?
No, I never swim in shark-infested waters.

[Paige comes out of the pool naked]
I couldn't find a towel either.
Your Dad hit you.
You wouldn't understand.

When I was six years old, I was running through the house and I knocked over a lamp and it broke. My Dad beat the hell out of me. He just didn't spank me, he hit me with his fist, game me two black eyes, Jason. I was six years old! When I was 10, I got home from school one day, my Dad hit me in the stomach and I didn't know why. I didn't ask. But I told myself, "Hey he's just blowing off steam, right?" It was hard to say out loud that he abused me. I was wrong! He was wrong! Jason, you don't have to go through your whole life denying it like I did. All you got to do is tell me to take you someplace else, kid. Tell me to take you someplace else. just tell me to take you someplace else.

[Jason looks at Mac, for a moment]
Take me someplace else.
Now, I mean it, Abby. I just want an answer.
Well, I'm not saying we're having an affair and I'm not saying I'm not. I am saying that I can have him any time I want him.
You're only here with Mack now, because I wasn't here when he met you. Now he feels obligated.
Mack is under no obligations, Anne.
The hell he isn't. Admit it. If Mack had to choose between us, he'd never choose you.
You with your little tract house, your little dead-end street in your little dead-end life with your outdoor barbecue and your "Kiss the Cook" apron. It all makes me sick.
Anne, I'm gonna get off the phone right now, I think we've said about...
You wanna know the truth. I'll tell you the truth. I never intended to die, I intended to make Mack come to his senses. I did it so that Mack could choose between us.
[Mack is shown listening to what Anne is saying]

[later on, at Mack and Karen's house]
I never give a gift unless I like it myself and I love hot dogs.
[Mack puts on a "Kiss the Cook" apron]
Especially when they're charcoal barbecued. I'll even put your names in them. You know, Karen, I love our house and listen...I love how quiet it is on our cul-de-sac.
[Karen is speechless and looks at Anne, who has a flabbergasted look on her face]
How about this dress for her first birthday? This one for her baptism. This is one for her second birthday. And, uh, this one for when she turns three, huh?
Whoa, wait a minute. Laura, I heard of planning ahead, but this is really planning ahead.
Well, I have to plan ahead.
Why?
Because there's a lot of things that I'm not going to do with Meg.
[Laura looks at Karen and realizes that Laura is dying]
Don't get upset, I mean. If you're gonna get upset, I'm gonna get upset, okay. I'm sorry. Please, please, I really need your help.
Look, I'm just going away for treatment, that's all.
You're going away to die.
It's a very good clinic.
It must be a hell of a place if people go there to die. I want to be there.
I wanna be alone. It's my choice.
It's not just your choice.
It is my choice.

Will you quit saying that! Your choice, your choice! What the hell am I? Nothing? A zero? I have a choice to you know and I choose to be there. You want me to imagine how you feel? Well, try to imagine how I feel saying when you say that I can't be there.
I just don't want you to watch me, it's that simple.
For years, you have lied, cheated and conned people and you gotten away with it, but I'm not gonna let you get away with this.
You're good. You really are. If I were rating on the Abby scale, Abby being ten, you'd be a six, which is very good considering your youth and ignorance.
Well, I don't judge things on the Abby scale, and neither does Greg.
Don't count on it.
I don't want you to die.
Would you just do what you know and I know has to be done?

[Karen signs the sheet to possibly have Sid undergo surgery to restore the loss of his limbs]
But I swear to God, Sid, if anything happens to you.

[handing Abby a copy of what he'll settle for in their divorce settlement]
Here, this should be to your liking.
It's nice, but it's not enough.
Give it to me!
Give you what?
[Abby pushes the cocaine on her nose and shoves it into her nostril]
Give me your car keys.
I have to have a car to go to school.
I told you I would not allow you to use drugs, you're not going to school. Give me your house keys.
What are you gonna do? Lock me out?
No, I'm not gonna lock you out. I'm gonna lock you in with me.

[on a different show, Abby chops down the bathroom door, to stop Olivia from snuffing cocaine]
Mom!
Go to bed, Brian.
All right, give it to me.
I don't have anything.
Give it to me!
I don't have anything!
Stop it!
Go to bed, Brian. Stay right there and don't you move. If you think hiding your drugs is gonna make any difference, Olivia, that you think I'm not gonna know.
I wasn't do anything. I was just...
[Abby finds the bag in the toilet]
